column5: Hey folks I just wanted to give every one a FYI about this tourney on Longpoint Bay it's a fun event and gets ya out there fishing here's the info  http://straitlineanglers.com/LongPointPike/LongPointPikeTournament.htm  There is also another tourney the following weekend on the 14th for the LPBAA which is also a fun tourney  http://longpointbayanglersassociation.com/calendar/event.php?eid=20090314083649542  Hope to see some OFNers out for these come say hi if you do.
Forgot about the SLA tourney, gonna be a busy May
Hope to see ya there buddy it will be lots of fun this year being a week later than normal it might not be as miserable as it has been and hopefully I can do better than 11lbs for 2 pike this year
sounds like fun.  If I get my new boat the weekend before I may come out for it
Do you need boat insurance to enter?
Thanks!  I read the rules on the first link YOU posted and it says nothing about insurance. I've never done a tournament but I thought most require a special type of insurance.
No different then any other day on the water. We wont be checking for insurance. Hoping to draw a good field for the event!
since there are no stupid questions , i'll ask  What the heck is straight line angling?

Strait Line Anglers  "The most common question about the club is the name and it's spelling "Strait" rather then "Straight". It's simply a play-on-words. Strait is a name of a long, large size water-body, such as the Davis Strait. This is somewhat descriptive to the waters that our club members typically fish- Lake Ontario and Lake Erie."
Thats all the info I had. I am not a member of the club, so all I can tell you is what is on their site.I have never been checked for insurance at a tourney
